did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Georgetown Volunteer Fire Co. No. 1 Collection
did.abstract: The Georgetown Volunteer Fire Co. Collection contains papers, ephemera, and realia relating to the Georgetown Volunteer Fire Company.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the G&B Cultural Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item Description, Date], Georgetown Volunteer Fire Co. No. 1 Collection, [Item no., Box no.], G&B Cultural Center, Wilton, Conn.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Georgetown Volunteer Fire Co., No. 1, Inc., was founded in 1928. Since the beginning the local community has worked together to support the cause. Of particular note has been the Heibeck family, which has supplied three separate Fire Chiefs, trained EMTs, and numerous lifetime members of the Georgetown Volunteer Fire Co. Besides local families, the fire department was supported from the beginning by the Gilbert & Bennett Mfg. Co., which donated the converted horse barn that served as the original firehouse. That structure tragically burned down in 1946. The community pulled together and quickly rebuilt a new firehouse by 1947. A major addition to the building was added in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Georgetown Volunteer Fire Co. Collection contains financial information including solicitations for donations, anniversary programs containing company histories, newspaper clippings relating to the company and fires in Georgetown, and a few photographs and postcards.
